comments:
Eclipse 20021217

Started new eclipse.  Updated existing workspace with both source and binary 
projects.  Changed preferences on Window>Preferences>Workspace>Editors (turned 
editor pop-down on, and tab compression to low).  The following exception was

This happens at the end of an Export (WorkbenchPreferenceDialog.savePressed 
handles the Export button).
I still don't see how this can happen though, since close only disposes the 
widgets after saving the selection.
I looked through all other senders of close(), okPressed(), cancelPressed() 
and didn't see anything that would lead to this.

Should probably just add an isDisposed() check in 
PreferenceDialog.setSelectedNode.

Andrew, could you try:
- open prefs
- select as many items in the tree as you can to get their pages to load
- export your prefs
Tried your suggestion, no more exceptions were generated.
Please try to reproduce this, and consider the fix in comment #1.

There is no need to cache the node on close anyways so the call to 
setSelectedNode can just be deleted.

Fixed in build >20030213
